todoist¶

exception pytodoist.todoist.AuthError(response)[source]¶

Raised when Todoist authentication fails.

exception pytodoist.todoist.BadValueError(response)[source]¶

Raised when an invalid parameter is passed in an API call.

exception pytodoist.todoist.InternalError(response)[source]¶

Raised when an error occurs due to Todoist server problems.

class pytodoist.todoist.Label(json, owner)[source]¶

A Todoist label with the following attributes:

delete()[source]¶

Delete the label.

>>> from pytodoist import todoist
>>> user = todoist.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> label = user.create_label('work')
>>> label.delete()
update()[source]¶

Update the label’s details on Todoist.

You must call this method to register any local attribute changes with Todoist.

>>> from pytodoist import todoist
>>> user = todoist.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> label = user.create_label('work')
>>> label.name = 'football'
... # At this point Todoist still thinks the name is 'work'
>>> label.update()
... # Now the name has been updated on Todoist.
exception pytodoist.todoist.NotFoundError(response)[source]¶

Raised when a Todoist object cannot be found.

class pytodoist.todoist.Note(json, task)[source]¶

A Todoist note with the following attributes:

delete()[source]¶

Delete the note, removing it from it’s task.

>>> from pytodoist import todoist
>>> user = todoist.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> project = user.get_project('Homework')
>>> task = user.add_task('Read Chapter 4.')
>>> note = task.add_note('Page 56')
>>> note.delete()
>>> notes = task.get_notes()
>>> len(notes)
0
update()[source]¶

Update the note’s details on Todoist.

You must call this method to register any local attribute changes with Todoist.

>>> from pytodoist import todoist
>>> user = todoist.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> project = user.get_project('Homework')
>>> task = user.add_task('Read Chapter 4.')
>>> note = task.add_note('Page 56')
>>> note.content = 'Page 65'
... # At this point Todoist still thinks the content is 'Page 56'
>>> note.update()
... # Now the content has been updated on Todoist.
class pytodoist.todoist.Project(json, owner)[source]¶

A Todoist Project with the following attributes:

Variables:
  • user_id – The user ID of the owner.
  • name – The name of the project.
  • color – The color of the project.
  • is_deleted – Has this project been deleted?
  • collapsed – Is this project collapsed?
  • cache_count – The cache count of the project.
  • inbox_project – Is this project the Inbox?
  • archived_date – The date on which the project was archived.
  • item_order – The task ordering.
  • indent – The indentation level of the project.
  • is_archived – Is this project archived?
  • archived_timestamp – The timestamp of the project archiving.
  • owner – The owner of the project.
  • last_updated – When the project was last updated.
  • id – The ID of the project.
add_task(content, date=None, priority=None)[source]¶

Add a task to the project

Parameters:
  • content (string) – The task description.
  • date (string) – The task deadline.
  • priority (int) – The priority of the task.
Returns:

The added task.
Return type:

pytodoist.todoist.Task

 
>>> from pytodoist import todoist
>>> user = todoist.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> project = user.get_project('Homework')
>>> task = project.add_task('Read chapter 4.')
>>> task.content
u'Read Chapter 4'

Archive the project.

>>> from pytodoist import todoist
>>> user = todoist.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> project = user.get_project('Homework')
>>> project.archive()

>>> project = user.get_project('Homework')

get_completed_tasks()[source]¶

Return a list of all completed tasks in this project.

Returns:A list of all completed tasks in this project.
Return type:list (pytodoist.todoist.Task) 
>>> from pytodoist import todoist
>>> user = todoist.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> project = user.get_project('Homework')
>>> task = project.add_task('Read chapter 4.')
>>> task.complete()
>>> completed_tasks = project.get_completed_tasks()
>>> for task in completed_tasks:
...    print task.content
u'Read Chapter 4.'
get_tasks()[source]¶

Return all tasks in this project.

Returns:A list of all tasks in this project.
Return type:list (pytodoist.todoist.Task) 
>>> from pytodoist import todoist
>>> user = todoist.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> project = user.get_project('Homework')
>>> project.add_task('Read chapter 4.')
>>> tasks = project.get_tasks()
>>> for task in tasks:
...    print task.content
u'Read Chapter 4.'
get_uncompleted_tasks()[source]¶

Return a list of all uncompleted tasks in this project.

Returns:A list of all uncompleted tasks in this project.
Return type:list (pytodoist.todoist.Task) 
>>> from pytodoist import todoist
>>> user = todoist.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> project = user.get_project('Homework')
>>> project.add_task('Read chapter 4.')
>>> uncompleted_tasks = project.get_uncompleted_tasks()
>>> for task in uncompleted_tasks:
...    print task.content
u'Read Chapter 4.'
unarchive()[source]¶

Unarchive the project.

>>> from pytodoist import todoist
>>> user = todoist.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> project = user.get_project('Homework')
>>> project.unarchive()
update()[source]¶

Update the project’s details on Todoist.

You must call this method to register any local attribute changes with Todoist.

Raises TodoistError:
 If the request to update is invalid. 
>>> from pytodoist import todoist
>>> user = todoist.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> project = user.get_project('Homework')
>>> project.name = 'Find Employment'
... # At this point Todoist still thinks the name is 'Homework'
>>> project.update()
... # Now the name has been updated on Todoist.
>>> project = user.get_project('Homework')
>>> project == None
True
update_task_orders(tasks)[source]¶

Update the order in which tasks are displayed on Todoist.

Parameters:tasks (list (pytodoist.todoist.Task)) – A list of tasks in the order to be displayed. 
>>> from pytodoist import todoist
>>> user = todoist.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> project = user.get_project('Homework')
>>> tasks = project.get_tasks()
>>> rev_tasks = tasks[::-1]
>>> project.update_task_orders(rev_tasks)
exception pytodoist.todoist.RegistrationError(response)[source]¶

Raised when Todoist registration fails.

class pytodoist.todoist.Task(json, project)[source]¶

A Todoist Task with the following attributes:

add_note(content)[source]¶

Add a note to the Task.

Parameters:content (string) – The content of the note.
Returns:The added note.
Return type:pytodoist.todoist.Note 
>>> from pytodoist import todoist
>>> user = todoist.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> project = user.get_project('Homework')
>>> task = user.add_task('Read Chapter 4.')
>>> note = task.add_note('Page 56')
>>> note.content
u'Page 56'
advance_recurring_date()[source]¶

Advance the recurring date of this task.

>>> from pytodoist import todoist
>>> user = todoist.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> project = user.get_project('Homework')
>>> task = user.add_task('Read Chapter 4.')
>>> task.due_date
Sun 09 Mar 2014 19:54:01 +0000
>>> task.advance_recurring_date()
>>> task.due_date
Sun 10 Mar 2014 19:54:01 +0000
complete()[source]¶

Mark the task complete.

>>> from pytodoist import todoist
>>> user = todoist.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> project = user.get_project('Homework')
>>> task = user.add_task('Read Chapter 4.')
>>> task.complete()

>>> task.delete()
get_notes()[source]¶

Return all notes attached to this Task.

Returns:A list of all notes attached to this Task.
Return type:list (pytodoist.todoist.Note) 
>>> from pytodoist import todoist
>>> user = todoist.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> project = user.get_project('Homework')
>>> task = user.add_task('Read Chapter 4.')
>>> task.add_note('Page 56')
>>> notes = task.get_notes()
>>> len(notes)
1
move(project)[source]¶

Move this task to another project.

Parameters:project (pytodoist.todoist.Project) – The project to move the task to. 
>>> from pytodoist import todoist
>>> user = todoist.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> project = user.get_project('Homework')
>>> task = user.add_task('Read Chapter 4.')
>>> task.project.name
u'Homework'
>>> inbox = user.get_project('Inbox')
>>> task.move(inbox)
>>> task.project.name
u'Inbox'
uncomplete()[source]¶

Mark the task uncomplete.

>>> from pytodoist import todoist
>>> user = todoist.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> project = user.get_project('Homework')
>>> task = user.add_task('Read Chapter 4.')
>>> task.uncomplete()
update()[source]¶

Update the task’s details on Todoist.

You must call this method to register any local attribute changes with Todoist.

Raises:
  • TodoistError – If the request to update is invalid.
  • NotFoundError – If the task cannot be found on Todoist.
 
>>> from pytodoist import todoist
>>> user = todoist.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> project = user.get_project('Homework')
>>> task = user.add_task('Read Chapter 4.')
>>> task.content = 'Read Chapter 5'
... # At this point Todoist still thinks the content is 'Read Chapter 4'
>>> task.update()
... # Now the content has been updated on Todoist.
exception pytodoist.todoist.TodoistError(response)[source]¶

Will be raised whenever a Todoist API call fails.

This is the generic TodoistError that will be raised when there are no others suitable.

class pytodoist.todoist.User(json)[source]¶

A Todoist User that has the following attributes:

Variables:
  • full_name – The user’s full name.
  • start_page – The first page the user will see on Todoist.
  • join_date – The date the user joined Todoist.
  • last_used_ip – The IP address of the computer last used to login.
  • is_premium – Does the user have Todoist premium?
  • sort_order – The user’s sort order.
  • api_token – The user’s API token.
  • shard_id – The user’s shard ID.
  • timezone – The user’s chosen timezone.
  • id – The ID of the user.
  • next_week – The day on which a task is delayed until.
  • tz_offset – The user’s timezone offset.
  • email – The user’s email address.
  • start_day – The first day of the week.
  • is_dummy – Is this a real or a dummy user?
  • inbox_project – The ID of the user’s Inbox project.
  • time_format – The user’s selected time_format.
  • image_id – The ID of the user’s avatar.
  • beta – The user’s beta status.
  • premium_until – The date on which the user’s premium status is revoked.
  • mobile_number – The user’s mobile number.
  • mobile_host – The host of the user’s mobile.
  • password – The user’s password.
  • has_push_reminders – Does this user have push reminders?
  • date_format – The user’s selected date format.
  • karma – The user’s karma.
  • karma_trend – The user’s karma trend.
  • token – The user’s secret token.
  • seq_no – The user’s sequence number.
  • default_reminder – The user’s default reminder.
add_project(name, color=None, indent=None, order=None)[source]¶

Add a project to the user’s account.

Parameters:
  • name (string) – The project name.
  • color (int) – The project color.
  • indent (int) – The project indentation.
  • order (int) – The project ordering.
Returns:

The project that was added.
Return type:

pytodoist.todoist.Project
Raises BadValueError:
 

If the project name is empty.

 
>>> from pytodoist import todoist
>>> user = todoist.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> project = user.add_project('Homework', color=1)
>>> project.name
u'Homework'
change_avatar(image)[source]¶

Change the user’s avatar.

Parameters:image (string) – The path to the image.
Raises BadValueError:
 If the image is an invalid format, too big or unable to be resized. 
>>> from pytodoist import todoist
>>> user = todoist.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user.change_avatar('~/pictures/avatar.png')
create_label(name, color=None)[source]¶

Create a new label.

Parameters:name (string) – The name of the label.
Return type:pytodoist.todoist.Label 
>>> from pytodoist import todoist
>>> user = todoist.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> label = user.create_label('School')
delete(reason=None)[source]¶

Delete the user’s account from Todoist.

Warning

You cannot recover the user after deletion!

Parameters:reason (string) – The reason for deletion.
Raises AuthError:
 If user.password is wrong. 
>>> from pytodoist import todoist
>>> user = todoist.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user.delete()
... # The user token is now invalid and Todoist operations will fail.

Return the project with a given name.

Parameters:project_name (string) – The name to search for.
Returns:The project that has the name project_name or None if no project is found.
Return type:pytodoist.todoist.Project 
>>> from pytodoist import todoist
>>> user = todoist.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> inbox = user.get_project('Inbox')
>>> inbox.name
u'Inbox'
get_project_with_id(project_id)[source]¶

Return the project with a given ID.

Parameters:project_id (string) – The ID to search for.
Returns:The project that has the ID project_id or None if no project is found.
Return type:pytodoist.todoist.Project 
>>> from pytodoist import todoist
>>> user = todoist.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> inbox = user.get_project('Inbox')
>>> project_id = inbox.id
>>> inbox = user.get_project_with_id(project_id)
>>> inbox.name
u'Inbox'

>>> user.add_project('Homework', color=1)
>>> projects = user.get_projects()

...    print project.name

is_email_notified_when(event)[source]¶

Find out if a user is receiving emails for a given event.

Parameters:event (string) – The type of the notification.
Returns:True if the user’s settings allow for emails, False otherwise.
Return type:bool 
>>> from pytodoist import todoist
>>> user = todoist.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user.is_email_notified_when('note_added')
True
is_logged_in()[source]¶

Return True if the user is logged in.

A user is logged in if it’s token is valid.

Returns:True if the user token is valid, False otherwise.
Return type:bool 
>>> from pytodoist import todoist
>>> user = todoist.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user.is_logged_in()
True
>>> user.delete()
>>> user.is_logged_in()
False
is_push_notified_when(event)[source]¶

Find out if a user is receiving push notifications for a given event.

Parameters:event (string) – The type of the notification.
Returns:True if the user’s settings allow for push notifications, False otherwise.
Return type:bool 
>>> from pytodoist import todoist
>>> user = todoist.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user.is_push_notified_when('note_added')
True
search_completed_tasks(label=None, interval=None)[source]¶

Return a filtered list of a user’s completed tasks.

Warning

Requires the user to have Todoist premium.

Parameters:
  • label (pytodoist.todoist.Label) – Only return tasks with this label.
  • interval (string) – Only return tasks completed this time period.
Returns:

A list of tasks that meet the search criteria. If the user does not have Todoist premium an empty list is returned.
Return type:

list (pytodoist.todoist.Task)

 
>>> from pytodoist import todoist
>>> user = todoist.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> tasks = user.search_completed_tasks(label='School')
search_tasks(queries)[source]¶

Return a list of tasks that match some search criteria.

Parameters:queries (list (string)) – Return tasks that match at least one of these queries.
Returns:A list tasks that match at least one query.
Return type:list (pytodoist.todoist.Task) 
>>> from pytodoist import todoist
>>> user = todoist.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> queries = ['today', 'tomorrow']
>>> tasks = user.search_tasks(queries)
update()[source]¶

Update the user’s details on Todoist.

You must call this method to register any local attribute changes with Todoist.

Raises:
  • TodoistError – If the request to update is invalid.
  • BadValueError – If one of the new values is invalid e.g. the new email address is associated with an existing account.
 
>>> from pytodoist import todoist
>>> user = todoist.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user.full_name = 'John Smith'
... # At this point Todoist still thinks the name is 'John Doe'.
>>> user.update()
... # Now the name has been updated on Todoist.
>>> user = todoist.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user.full_name
u'John Smith'
update_project_orders(projects)[source]¶

Update the order in which projects are displayed on Todoist.

Parameters:projects (list (pytodoist.todoist.Project)) – A list of projects in the order to be displayed. 
>>> from pytodoist import todoist
>>> user = todoist.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> projects = user.get_projects()
>>> for project in projects:
...    print project.name
u'Homework'
u'Shopping'
>>> rev_projects = projects[::-1]
>>> user.update_project_orders(rev_projects)
>>> projects = user.get_projects()
>>> for project in projects:
...    print project.name
u'Shopping'
u'Homework'
use_default_avatar()[source]¶

Change the user’s avatar to the Todoist default avatar.

>>> from pytodoist import todoist
>>> user = todoist.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user.use_default_avatar()

Return a list of Todoist supported timezones.

Returns:A list of timezones
Return type:list (string) 
>>> from pytodoist import todoist
>>> todoist.get_timezones()
[u'US/Hawaii', u'US/Alaska', u'US/Pacific', u'US/Arizona, ...]
pytodoist.todoist.login(email, password)[source]¶

Login to Todoist.

Parameters:
  • email (string) – A Todoist user’s email address.
  • password (string) – A Todoist user’s password.
Returns:

The Todoist user.
Return type:

pytodoist.todoist.User
Raises AuthError:
 

If the login credentials are incorrect.

 
>>> from pytodoist import todoist
>>> user = todoist.login('john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user.full_name
u'John Doe'
>>> user.join_date
u'Sun 09 Mar 2014 19:54:01 +0000'
pytodoist.todoist.login_with_google(email, oauth2_token)[source]¶

Login to Todoist using Google oauth2 authentication.

Parameters:
  • email (string) – A Todoist user’s email address.
  • oauth2_token (string) – The oauth2 token associated with the email.
Returns:

The Todoist user.
Return type:

pytodoist.todoist.User
Raises:
  • AuthError – If Google has refused to accept the token.
  • InternalError – If a server error occurs. Try again later.
  • BadValueError – If the token is valid but doesn’t match the email.

Note

It is up to you to obtain the valid oauth2 token.

>>> from pytodoist import todoist
... # Get the oauth2 token.
>>> user = todoist.login_with_google('john.doe@gmail.com', oauth2_token)
>>> user.full_name
u'John Doe'
>>> user.join_date
u'Sun 09 Mar 2014 19:54:01 +0000'
pytodoist.todoist.register(full_name, email, password, lang=None, timezone=None)[source]¶

Register a new Todoist account.

Parameters:
  • full_name (string) – The user’s full name.
  • email (string) – The user’s email address.
  • password (string) – The user’s password.
  • lang (string) – The user’s language.
  • timezone (string) – The user’s timezone.
Returns:

The Todoist user.
Return type:

pytodoist.todoist.User
Raises RegistrationError:
 

If an account with the given details exists.

 
>>> from pytodoist import todoist
>>> user = todoist.register('John Doe', 'john.doe@gmail.com', 'passwd')
>>> user.full_name
u'John Doe'
>>> user.join_date
u'Sun 09 Mar 2014 19:54:01 +0000'
pytodoist.todoist.register_with_google(full_name, email, oauth2_token, lang=None, timezone=None)[source]¶

Register a new Todoist account by linking a Google account.

Parameters:
  • full_name (string) – The user’s full name.
  • email (string) – The user’s email address.
  • oauth2_token (string) – The oauth2 token associated with the email.
  • lang (string) – The user’s language.
  • timezone (string) – The user’s timezone.
Returns:

The Todoist user.
Return type:

pytodoist.todoist.User
Raises:
  • AuthError – If Google has refused to accept the token.
  • InternalError – If a server error occurs. Try again later.
  • BadValueError – If the token is valid but doesn’t match the email.

Note

It is up to you to obtain the valid oauth2 token.

>>> from pytodoist import todoist
... # Get the oauth2 token.
>>> user = todoist.register_with_google('John Doe', 'john.doe@gmail.com',
...                                      oauth2_token)
>>> user.full_name
u'John Doe'
>>> user.join_date
u'Sun 09 Mar 2014 19:54:01 +0000'
